title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7.14 - Executive Order No. 14: Declaring an Emergency in the County of Erie and Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes for the Town of Clarence. [*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7.14 - Executive Order No. 14: Declaring an Emergency in the County of Erie and Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes for the Town of Clarence. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, at about 10:15 p.m. Eastern Standard Time, on

Thursday, February 12, 2009 a commuter twin-engine airplane crashed into a
house in the Town of Clarence, County of Erie during an instrument approach to

Buffalo International Airport, killing 49 passengers and one person on the
ground; and
WHEREAS, the plane crash has caused damage to residential
property, caused personal hardship and continues to pose a threat to the public
health and safety in the Town of Clarence, County of Erie; and
WHEREAS, real property taxes for the 2009 fiscal year are
currently due in the affected town; and
WHEREAS, section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law authorizes the Governor to issue an Executive

Order during a State Disaster Emergency, extending the period for paying real
property taxes without interest; and
WHEREAS, a request for such an extension has been received
on behalf of Erie County and the Town of Clarence; and
WHEREAS, given the hardships continuing to face the people
of the Town of Clarence as a result of the plane crash, such an extension is
eminently warranted; and
NOW, THEREFORE, I, DAVID PATERSON, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby find that a disaster has occurred for which
the affected local governments are unable to respond adequately, and pursuant
to Section 28 of Article 2-B of the Executive Law, do hereby declare a State

Disaster Emergency within Erie County; and
FURTHER, pursuant to Section 29 of Article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct the implementation of the State Disaster Preparedness

Plan and authorize all necessary State agencies to take appropriate action to
assist affected local governments and individuals in responding to and
recovering from this disaster, to protect state and local property, and to
provide such other assistance as is necessary to protect public health and
safety. FURTHER, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby
extend to February 24, 2009 the period for paying without interest the real
property taxes that are currently due in the Town of Clarence. Signed: David A. Paterson

Dated: February 13, 2009

Footnotes
*
[Revoked by Executive Order

No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra. ]
